parcours.description: Your crucial mission will be to integrate analytics into our strategic decisions in order to improve the performance of our group. Get ready, because I am convinced that you are the ideal person to successfully carry out this mission. We trust you!

menu.title: Strategic Game
menu.desc1: You have been appointed by the company's president as the leader of the Analytics task force, whose mission is to improve the company's performance by integrating Analytics through data-driven decisions.
menu.desc2: It is up to you to choose the right strategies and make the best decisions to optimize your score.
menu.descConfig: Before starting the journey, please configure your character. The name you choose will appear in the rankings. Once the configuration is validated, you will not be able to modify it.

listMission.title: THE PRESIDENT
listMission.text1: Hello, I am proud to have you as one of the collaborators in our company. Get ready, because I have decided to call on you for a special mission!
listMission.text2: I have just appointed you as the head of the Analytics Task Force, which is responsible for carrying out a crucial mission for our group...
listMission.text3: The mission consists of improving the company's performance by integrating analytics through data-driven decisions. Are you ready?

modal.description: You are the catalyst for our digital transformation, inspiring innovation at every step of our journey.
modal.name_taskforce: Give a name to your task force.

part1.g_title: Among the following propositions, select those that seem most relevant to you.

As a member of our data analysis team, it is crucial to master this vocabulary in order to carry out our missions successfully and ensure the security of our clients.
part1.decisions_title: What is the main objective of data analysis?

decisions.1: To find hidden information in data
decisions.3: To store data for later use
decisions.4: To archive historical data of the company

part2.g_title: The production manager is calling to inquire about the characteristics of Analytics.
part2.s_description: Help him understand the advantages, disadvantages, challenges, and prospects of analytics.

decisions.5: Improved decision-making based on data rather than assumptions or hypotheses.
decisions.6: Process optimization by identifying bottlenecks, inefficiencies, and opportunities for improvement in company processes.
decisions.7: Better understanding of customers by improving understanding of customer needs, behaviors, and preferences, which can lead to higher satisfaction and increased loyalty.
decisions.8: Trend prediction by identifying emerging market trends and anticipating future customer needs.
decisions.9: Improved profitability by identifying unnecessary costs and optimizing investments.
decisions.10: Implementing a data analytics system can be costly in terms of investment in equipment, software, and qualified personnel.
decisions.11: Data analysis can be complex, requiring specialized skills in data collection, storage, processing, and analysis.
decisions.12: Data analysis may involve sensitive company data, which can lead to security risks if not properly managed.
decisions.13: Data analysis can generate massive amounts of data, which can make their management difficult and costly.
decisions.14: Implementing data analytics may require a change in company culture to encourage data-based decision-making rather than intuition or assumptions.
decisions.15: Company staff may require additional training to understand how to use data analytics tools and interpret results.
decisions.16: Data analysis may require the integration of different existing systems within the company, which can be complex and expensive.
decisions.17: Data analysis is still an emerging field with significant potential for application in many areas.
decisions.18: Data analysis may require the development of new skills for company workers, which can lead to new career and professional development opportunities.
decisions.19: Rapid technological advances can lead to rapid changes in the use and application fields of data analytics.

messages.title: THE PRESIDENT
messages.text1: Are you sure about your choices?
messages.text2: On entend souvent parler de la pharmacovigilance, et il existe beaucoup d’idées préconçues à son sujet. Maintenant que vous vous y connaissez un peu, saurez-vous distinguer le vrai du faux ?
messages.text3: Before starting your mission, I would like to make sure that you have understood the stakes of data analysis.
messages.text4: Congratulations on successfully completing the first phase of our data analysis project. Your contribution and hard work have been greatly appreciated, and we are looking forward to seeing the results of your analysis.

listMsg.title: DIRECTOR OF INFORMATION SYSTEMS:
listMsg.text1:
Data analysis, also referred to as analytics, is the method of collecting, processing, and scrutinizing data to derive insights and make informed decisions. This involves utilizing statistical techniques and tools to identify patterns, trends, and connections within the data. For businesses, data analysis is vital as it allows them to comprehend their customers' behavior, streamline their operations, and improve their profitability.

Through data analysis, businesses can recognize the products and services that their customers crave, and they can adjust their marketing strategies accordingly. They can also optimize their inventory and cut costs, leading to increased profitability and competitiveness.
listMsg.text2:
However, data analysis comes with its own set of challenges. One of the most significant challenges is the quality of the data. Inaccurate, incomplete, or inconsistent data can lead to faulty insights and decisions.

Another challenge is the complexity of the data. With the explosion of data sources and types, it can be challenging to integrate and analyze the data effectively. Additionally, the shortage of skilled data analysts and the high cost of analytical tools can act as entry barriers for many businesses.
listMsg.text3: As the world becomes increasingly digital, the significance of data analysis will only intensify. Emerging technologies such as machine learning and artificial intelligence are making it easier and quicker to analyze vast amounts of data. Nevertheless, businesses will need to continue investing in data quality and data analysis skills to fully capitalize on the benefits of data analysis.
listMsg.text4:
Un évènement indésirable est jugé grave s’il :
        Est létal
        Met en jeu le pronostic vital
        Nécessite une hospitalisation ou une prolongation d’hospitalisation
        Est responsable d’un déficit ou d’une incapacité persistante et significative
        Constitue une anomalie congénitale
        Médicalement significatif (nécessite un traitement/intervention chirurgicale)

Une situation spéciale est un cas de PV pouvant être associé ou non à un EI médicamenteux (EIM)
        • Utilisation d’un médicament pendant la grossesse ou l’allaitement, lorsque non autorisée
       • Utilisation dans la population pédiatrique ou âgée, lorsque non autorisée
       • Surdosage, Abus
       • Utilisation hors AMM
       • Mésusage, Erreur médicamenteuse
       • Exposition professionnelle
       • Manque d’efficacité thérapeutique.

msg1.title: Lead data science:
msg1.text: Before you start your mission, I want to make sure you understand the challenges and steps involved in data collection and utilization.

validation.title: Lead data science:
validation.text: Are you sure about your choices?
validation.text1: Congratulations on successfully collecting and leveraging data for our project. Your expertise in this field has been invaluable to the team, and we are confident that the information you have gathered will help us make informed decisions for the future. Thank you for your hard work and dedication to this project.

listMsg.title: DIRECTOR OF INFORMATION SYSTEMS
listMsg.msg1:
When collecting and utilizing data in a business, there are several critical aspects to consider. Firstly, it is essential to define the objectives of the data collection clearly. Understanding the purpose of data collection and how it aligns with the overall strategy and goals of the company is crucial.

Next, identifying pertinent data sources is necessary, as companies must collect data from various sources, such as customer data, market data, and relevant internal data sources.

Furthermore, it is vital to ensure that the collected data is accurate, relevant, and up-to-date. Therefore, companies need to establish quality control measures to maintain the integrity of the data.

Additionally, the collected data must be stored and processed in compliance with data protection regulations, such as GDPR or CCPA.
listMsg.msg2:
Analytics have numerous use cases. For example, analytics can be utilized to identify customer segments and behavior patterns, personalize marketing campaigns, optimize pricing and promotions, and forecast demand.

In operations, analytics can be used to improve the supply chain and inventory management, enhance production processes, reduce costs, and identify areas for improvement.

Analytics can also improve the customer experience by identifying pain points, predicting customer needs, and providing personalized recommendations.

In the field of risk management, analytics can be used to prevent and detect fraud, monitor compliance, and assess risks in financial transactions. In human resources, analytics can be used to boost employee engagement and retention, streamline recruitment and hiring processes, and identify training and development needs.
listMsg.msg3: These are just a few examples of the many possible use cases for analytics. The possibilities are virtually limitless, and organizations in all industries leverage analytics to gain insights, make informed decisions, and achieve their goals. However, it is vital to remember that data collection and maintaining their quality are important prerequisites for the success of each use case.

day3.niveau: LEVEL 3 : Understanding what the data is telling us (Descriptive approach)

leftMsg.title: PRODUCTION MANAGER
leftMsg.message1: To perform effective descriptive analysis, it is essential to have a comprehensive and structured data collection, including relevant variables to answer the business questions posed.
leftMsg.message2: To achieve high-quality predictive analysis, it is crucial to have quality historical data, use appropriate modeling techniques, and adopt a rigorous approach to continuously evaluate and improve forecasting accuracy.
leftMsg.message3: To achieve high-quality predictive analysis, it is crucial to have quality historical data, use appropriate modeling techniques, and adopt a rigorous approach to continuously evaluate and improve forecasting accuracy.
leftMsg.message4: To achieve high-quality predictive analysis, it is crucial to have quality historical data, use appropriate modeling techniques, and adopt a rigorous approach to continuously evaluate and improve forecasting accuracy.
leftMsg.message5: Prescriptive analysis relies on a combination of historical data, predictive models, and business rules to recommend concrete and optimal actions to take in given situations, in order to improve performance and maximize value-added.

message_tuto.title: DIRECTOR OF INFORMATION SYSTEMS
message_tuto.message1:
Descriptive analysis is a method of data analysis that aims to summarize and present data in a way that helps people understand patterns, trends, and relationships.

This type of analysis is important because it provides a clear and concise summary of what has happened in the past or what is currently happening in a given set of data.

Understanding these patterns and trends can help organizations make better decisions and identify areas for improvement.
message_tuto.message2:
There are several commonly used tools in descriptive analysis that can help people understand their data.

Measures of central tendency such as mean, median, and mode are used to describe the typical or average value of a set of data, while measures of variability such as standard deviation, variance, range, and interquartile range describe the spread of data.
message_tuto.message3:
Frequency distributions can be displayed using histograms or bar charts to show the number of times each value or range of values appears in a set of data.

Cross-tabulation involves comparing two or more variables to identify patterns or relationships, while scatterplots display the relationship between two variables as points on a graph.
message_tuto.message4:
Box plots show the distribution of data using quartiles, and time series analysis tracks and analyzes trends and patterns of data over a given period.

Heatmaps are used to visualize the relationship between two variables in a dataset using color-coding, while pivot tables are used to summarize and analyze large datasets quickly.
message_tuto.message5: In summary, descriptive analysis tools help to provide information about the data, summarize the main characteristics, and reveal patterns and relationships, making them essential for gaining insights and making informed decisions in various fields.

message_tuto.title: DIRECTOR OF INFORMATION SYSTEMS
message_tuto.message1:
Predictive analysis is a type of data analysis that utilizes statistical and machine learning methods to examine past and current data in order to forecast future trends and events.

It involves creating models based on patterns and relationships in the data to predict future outcomes.
message_tuto.message2:
Predictive analysis is used across various industries such as finance, healthcare, and business to help make better decisions.

For instance, it can be used to anticipate customer behavior or predict a patient's likelihood of developing a specific medical condition.
message_tuto.message3:
The predictive analysis process consists of several steps, including data collection, cleaning, feature engineering, model selection, and evaluation.

Once a predictive model is created, it can be used to generate forecasts based on new data. This tool is essential for organizations to anticipate issues before they happen, recognize growth opportunities, and enhance their operational efficiency.
message_tuto.message4:
There are many tools and techniques used in predictive analysis, including :

• Statistical analysis software such as R, SAS, and SPSS.

• Machine learning libraries such as scikit-learn, TensorFlow, and Keras.

• Data visualization tools like Tableau and Power BI.

• Big data technologies such as Apache Hadoop and Apache Spark.

• Natural language processing (NLP) tools like NLTK and spaCy.
message_tuto.message5:
Regression, classification, and clustering are three fundamental techniques used in predictive analysis.

Regression predicts a continuous numerical value based on input variables, classification predicts a categorical variable based on input variables, and clustering groups similar data points based on their characteristics.
message_tuto.message6: These techniques are used in different types of analysis and are suitable for various kinds of data.
message_tuto.message7: Regression models are commonly used in financial analysis and marketing, classification models are commonly used in marketing and healthcare, and clustering models are commonly used in customer segmentation and fraud detection.

listMsg.title: DIRECTOR OF INFORMATION SYSTEMS
listMsg.text1:
Prescriptive analysis is a branch of advanced analytics that uses predictive modeling, optimization techniques, and machine learning algorithms to recommend actions for optimizing outcomes. It is the highest level of data analysis, building on descriptive and predictive analysis.

Prescriptive analysis uses information generated by descriptive and predictive analysis to suggest a course of action. It takes into account various constraints and trade-offs, such as resource availability, costs, and risks, to provide decision-makers with multiple options to achieve their goals.
listMsg.text2:
Prescriptive analysis has a wide range of applications in different sectors, such as healthcare, finance, marketing, and operations management. For example, in healthcare, prescriptive analysis can help doctors determine the best treatment plans for their patients based on medical history, demographic data, and patient risk factors.

In finance, it can help financial advisors recommend investment portfolios that meet their clients' financial goals and risk preferences. In operations management, it can help optimize supply chain management, production planning, and inventory control.
listMsg.text3:
Here is a concrete example of prescriptive analysis. Let's say a retailer wants to optimize its pricing strategy to increase revenue and profit. It has historical sales data, competitive pricing data, and customer demographic data.

First, it uses descriptive analysis to understand its current pricing strategy, identify trends and patterns, and gain insights into customer buying behavior.

Next, it uses predictive analysis to forecast sales and estimate the impact of different pricing scenarios on revenue and profit.
listMsg.text4:
For instance, it can simulate how different prices for a product category would affect demand and sales volume. Finally, it uses prescriptive analysis to recommend an optimal pricing strategy.

It takes into account various constraints and trade-offs, such as inventory levels, price elasticity, and profit margins, to suggest a range of pricing options that would achieve its objectives.
listMsg.text5:
For example, it may recommend increasing the price of high-margin products to increase profits while lowering the price of low-margin products to increase sales volume. It may also recommend dynamic pricing strategies that adjust prices in real-time based on demand, inventory levels, and competitive pricing.

Overall, prescriptive analysis enables retailers to make data-driven pricing decisions that maximize revenue and profit while balancing various constraints and business objectives.
listMsg.text6:
Advantages:

• Results optimization: Prescriptive analysis can help businesses optimize results by recommending the best course of action based on multiple variables and constraints.

• Flexibility: Prescriptive analysis models can be customized to meet the specific needs and objectives of the business. They can also be updated and refined as new data becomes available.

• Automation: Prescriptive analysis can automate decision-making processes, reducing the need for manual intervention and improving the speed and accuracy of decision-making.

• Risk reduction: Prescriptive analysis can help businesses identify and mitigate potential risks by analyzing different scenarios and recommending strategies to minimize negative outcomes.
listMsg.text7:
Disadvantages:

• Complexity: Prescriptive analysis models can be complex and require specialized knowledge and skills to develop and implement. This can make it challenging for businesses without sufficient resources to leverage this technology.

• Data quality: Prescriptive analysis models require high-quality and reliable data to generate accurate insights and recommendations. Poor data quality can lead to inaccurate results and faulty decision-making.

• Cost: Prescriptive analysis can be expensive to implement and maintain, particularly for smaller businesses with limited resources.

DiscussMessage.title: Sales Director
DiscussMessage.text1: Let's see what you're going to do with the data. Go ahead and select the first folder.
DiscussMessage.text2: To maximize the added value of analytics, it is essential to have complete and reliable data, use appropriate analytical techniques, and adopt a rigorous approach to continuously evaluate and improve the quality of the results obtained.
DiscussMessage.text3: The role of analytical teams in data processing is crucial to ensure the quality and reliability of the analyses performed, as well as to ensure that the decisions made from the results are relevant and justified.
DiscussMessage.text4: Analytics is a continuous and iterative process that involves collecting, cleaning, processing, analyzing, and interpreting data to generate relevant insights and actionable knowledge, in order to support decision-making and maximize added value.
DiscussMessage.text5: If you are sure of your answers, you can validate the level using the button on the right. Otherwise, you can select each folder again to modify your answers.
DiscussMessage.text6: We will review the key steps of a data-driven approach.

You arrive at Dr. Hamidi's office and he tells you about an adverse event that occurred in his patient. Click on the audio to listen to the conversation again.

In this level, you will have to identify useful information in his message to fill out the notification form.
messages.message4: Congratulations! Your Task Force mission has come to an end. You have demonstrated commitment and involvement throughout the mission. I invite you to consult the activity report to get an idea of your performance in this game. Keep raising awareness about analytics among those around you!

validation.title: Lead Data Scientist:
validation.text: Are you sure of your choices?

directeur_general.title: THE GENERAL DIRECTOR
directeur_general.text: Congratulations! Your Task Force mission has come to an end. You have demonstrated commitment and involvement throughout the mission. I invite you to consult the activity report to get an idea of your performance in this game. Keep raising awareness about analytics among those around you!

responsable_m.title: Lead data science
responsable_m.text: Are you sure of your choices?

part1.title: For each of the following statements, indicate whether the statement is true or false by selecting the appropriate answer.
part1.s_title: Select the most relevant ones and place them in the most appropriate category of the notification form.

decisions.116: Optimization of results by recommending the best action
decisions.117: Flexibility thanks to the possibility of being customized to meet the specific needs and objectives of the company
decisions.119: Reduction of potential risks by analyzing the outcome of different scenarios
decisions.120: Generation of complex results requiring specialized knowledge and skills
decisions.121: Dependence on the quality of data used during analysis
decisions.122: Implementation budget that can be high and inaccessible for small and medium-sized enterprises
decisions.123: Obligation to comply with the ethical framework for data exploitation

part2.title: Among the following options, choose the most relevant one
part2.description: An adverse event is an unintended or unusual event affecting health that is related to the use of a product during a healthcare act.
part2.decisions_title: What is the difference between descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics?

decisions.124: Descriptive analytics involves using optimization techniques to recommend the best course of action, predictive analytics involves analyzing historical data to obtain insights, and prescriptive analytics involves using data and statistical algorithms to predict future outcomes.
decisions.125: Descriptive analytics involves analyzing historical data to obtain insights, predictive analytics involves using data and statistical algorithms to predict future outcomes, and prescriptive analytics involves using optimization techniques to recommend the best course of action.
decisions.126: Descriptive analytics involves using optimization techniques to recommend the best course of action, predictive analytics involves analyzing historical data to obtain insights, and prescriptive analytics involves using data and statistical algorithms to predict future outcomes.

msg_field_part_1: Unfortunately, you were unable to achieve the minimum score to validate this level!
